channel.description: Latest Prompt Engineering news in Context Engineering

item.title: Generative Value Conflicts Reveal LLM Priorities
item.description: arXiv:2509.25369v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Past work seeks to align large language model (LLM)-based assistants with a target set of values, but such assistants are frequently forced to make tradeoffs between values when deployed. In response to the scarcity of value conflict in existing align...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> alignment, model, prompt, prompting, large language model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Not Wrong, But Untrue: LLM Overconfidence in Document-Based Queries
item.description: arXiv:2509.25498v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language models (LLMs) are increasingly used in newsroom workflows, but their tendency to hallucinate poses risks to core journalistic practices of sourcing, attribution, and accuracy. We evaluate three widely used tools - ChatGPT, Gemini, and N...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> GPT, tool, context, prompt, model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Multi-level Diagnosis and Evaluation for Robust Tabular Feature Engineering with Large Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2509.25207v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent advancements in large language models (LLMs) have shown promise in feature engineering for tabular data, but concerns about their reliability persist, especially due to variability in generated outputs. We introduce a multi-level diagnosis and ...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> model, large language model, LLM, framework, few-shot | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Context-Engineering - "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy. A frontier, first-principles guide inspired by Karpathy and 3Blue1Brown for moving beyond prompt engineering to the wider discipline of context design, orchestration, and optimization.
item.description: "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy.
